title: How to use the screen of an old laptop with a Raspberry Pi - Quora

response.answer_text: I could be wrong, but I don’t think laptop screens are standardized enough in their electrical and logical interfaces that you can just hook anything up to them. There might be some other level of electronics that can be used to interface with your Pi to produce output on the laptop screen. I doubt whether you’ll find much info that documents the internals of a laptop that allows for replacing or extracting much beyond disk drives and memory.
We just can't use the screen of a laptop. If the laptop works, we can use VNC to connect to the raspberry pi. For more info on VNC refer: VNC (Virtual Network Computing)
